entry.title: A Simple Web Server
entry.content:
It happens that sometimes you need a web server for testing some application or you just want to share some directory while working on a project and you don’t want to configure apache server for such things or apache seems like an overkill. Python comes with a built in HTTP server module. By instantiating the server you can make any directory in your system into web directory. Navigate to the directory which you want to serve.

In python 2.x , you can use SimpleHTTPServer module python -m SimpleHTTPServer [port] if you don’t specify any port than server will start at port 8000.

In python 3.x , this is little simpler to write python -m http.server [port] Note:

  • This can handle only one request at a time and behaves like single threaded. Perhaps, you may want to write a script to make it multithreaded.
  • It is slow (I hope you got the point of being simple web server)
  • Sometimes causes timeout errors when loading JavaScript AMD modules using RequireJS.

Alternatively you may want to try http-server, a simplest NodeJS server

Installation $ npm install http-server starting the server http-server [path] [options] path : the directory path

and following options can be given

-p The port number to listen on [8080]
-a The host address to bind to [localhost]
-i Display directory index pages [True]
-s or --silent Silent mode won't log to the console
-h or --help Displays help message and exits

http-server can have parallel connections and works like a charm !.
